item.title: BELIEF Week Events
item.description: BELIEF Week is an annual event in the NIU College of Business. During BELIEF WEEK, NIU Business participants examine best practices in the field of business ethics. Corporate speakers from a variety of firms and industries explore this topic with NIU Business students in a variety of NIU Business classes. The week culminates with a keynote address, which will be given this year by Joan Dubinsky, Director of Ethics for the United Nations. BELIEF Week is open to all NIU students, alumni, friends, faculty and staff.
item.author: wmmccoy@niu.edu (William McCoy)

item.title: Belief Week Speaker - United Nations Ethics Director
item.description: The NIU College of Business is delighted to welcome Joan Dubinsky, Director of Ethics at the United Nations, as the keynote presenter during the college’s 2015 BELIEF Week series of events. BELIEF Week is an annual event created by the college’s nationally ranked program on ethics called BELIEF and by students in the LEAD student organization. Ms. Dubinsky’s 2015 address is entitled “When Dilemmas Meet Solutions: Global Perspectives in Ethical Challenges and Responsibilities.” Ms. Dubinsky’s presentation is open to all NIU students, faculty, alumni, and friends. For NIU Business students, this event is also Business Passport Approved. Ms. Dubinsky’s visit to NIU Business is sponsored by the NIU College of Business and its BELIEF program.
item.author: wmccoy@niu.edu (William McCoy)

item.title: Open House Reception at NIU Business
item.description: Open House Event – Welcome to your Future Academic Home! Very warm welcomes to each prospective student and your families and friends! We look forward to meeting you and talking with you about your interests, hopes, and dreams, and how our programs can help get you there! The NIU Business Open house reception will be held in Barsema Hall.
item.author: mdejean@niu.edu (Michelle DeJean)

item.title: Student Appreciation Day
item.description: This is one of our favorite times of the year, when we celebrate every NIU Business student! Your free lunch day is here! Be at the back of Barsema Hall by Dad’s Pond and pick up your lunch near the grill! College of Business Event

item.title: From Classroom to Career
item.description: Attend a half-day interactive workshop designed to help students and parents with educational and career success.During this free symposium, educators at all levels, counselors, business professionals, policy-makers, students, and parents will come together to address issues related to successful student transitions from secondary school to higher education and the professional world. The event will include three expert panel discussions and workshops all facilitated by 18 leaders and policy makers from collaborating universities, community colleges, and industry. 46th Illinois Lieutenant Governor Sheila Simon will provide a keynote speech on the importance of student success. NIU Business alumnus and faculty member Dennis Barsema is among the experts scheduled to speak, along with others from NIU.“From Classroom to Career” is hosted by the College of DuPage and runs from 8-noon on Friday, October 30, in the Jack H. Turner Conference Center at College of DuPage in Glen Ellyn. The event is free and open to the public however seating is limited. Reserve your seat by registering at this link: http://www.cod.edu/conferences/classroomtocareer/index.aspx

item.title: Thanksgiving Break
item.description: Have a wonderful Thanksgiving Break! Enjoy the holiday and time off with family and friends. We’ll see you when NIU Business and the university reopen during normal working hours on Monday, November 30th.
